name: Mercenary
description:
Due to an engine malfunction, your spaceship crashes on the planet Targ. Unlike your trusty vessel, you survive the crash and now have to find a way to get away from this planet. But hey, while you're at it, you might as well try to get some money off your unplanned stay on Targ.

You're a mercenary, and it just so happens that the two races on the planet are at war. So why not use that to your advantage and do some favors for each race... against cash?

You play this game in a first-person perspective with vector graphics. There's a huge planet for you to explore, you can walk around on it or take airborne vehicles to reach elevated locations.
alsoFor: Amstrad CPC, Atari 8-bit, Atari ST, Commodore 16, Plus/4, Commodore 64 | Combined View

shot.caption: The game's title screen. A countdown timer shows how much load time remains
Once the game has loaded the player must select their controller preference
Starting with a small green dot the player hurtles towards the wire framed planetary surface
At the last minute the computer returns the ship to manual control and, of course, a successful landing is achieved. Strange place out there
The computer supplies a status report. Crash landed on Taarg, Prestinium destroyed, State of war between Palyars and Mechanoids, location near airbase. There's a ship for sale there
The ships computer has stopped sending messages. Now I'm off exploring. This must be the airfield.
Everything is wire framed and can be flown through
Wire frames can be deceiving. This smudge looked like some sort of spider ....
... and turned out to be a bridge
